Article.Abstract: The repertoire of human cytotoxic T-lymphocytes (CTL) in response to influenza A viruses has been shown to be directed towards multiple epitopes, with a dominant response to the HLA-A2-restricted M1(58-66) epitope. These studies, however, were performed with peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMC) of individuals selected randomly with respect to HLA phenotype or selected for the expression of one HLA allele without considering an influence of other HLA molecules. In addition, little information is available on the influence of HLA makeup on the overall CTL response against influenza viruses. Here, the influenza A virus-specific CTL response was investigated in groups of HLA-A and -B identical individuals. Between groups the individuals shared two or three of the four HLA-A and -B alleles. After in vitro stimulation of PBMC with influenza virus, the highest CTL activity was found in HLA-A2(+) donors. A similar pattern was observed for the precursor frequency of virus-specific CTL (CTLp) ex vivo, with a higher CTLp frequency in HLA-A2-positive donors than in HLA-A2-negative donors, which were unable to recognize the immunodominant M1(58-66) epitope. In addition, CTL activity and frequency of CTLp for the individual influenza virus epitopes were determined. The frequency of CTLp specific for the HLA-B8-restricted epitope NP(380-388) was threefold lower in HLA-B27-positive donors than in HLA-B27-negative donors. In addition, the frequency of CTLp specific for the HLA-A1-restricted epitope NP(44-52) was threefold higher in HLA-A1-, -A2-, -B8-, and -B35-positive donors than in other donors, which was confirmed by measuring the CTL activity in vitro. These findings indicate that the epitope specificity of the CTL response is related to the phenotype of the other HLA molecules. Furthermore, the magnitude of the influenza virus-specific CTL response seems dependent on the HLA-A and -B phenotypes.
Article.ArticleTitle: The magnitude and specificity of influenza A virus-specific cytotoxic T-lymphocyte responses in humans is related to HLA-A and -B phenotype.
Article.Affiliations: Institute of Virology, Erasmus University Rotterdam, 3015 GE Rotterdam, The Netherlands.
Article.ArticleChemicalList: Antigens, Viral;Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte;HLA-A Antigens;HLA-A2 Antigen;HLA-B Antigens
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Adult; Alleles; Antigen-Presenting Cells(immunology); Antigens, Viral(immunology); Cytotoxicity, Immunologic(genetics); Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte(immunology); Genotype; HLA-A Antigens(genetics; immunology); HLA-A2 Antigen(genetics; immunology); HLA-B Antigens(genetics; immunology); Humans; Influenza A virus(immunology); Lymphocyte Count; Middle Aged; Phenotype; T-Lymphocytes, Cytotoxic(cytology; immunology)

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Influenza A Virus (H3N2) Resvir-9 is a reassortant between A/Puerto Rico/8/34 (H1N1) and A/Nanchang/933/95 (H3N2). Swiss-prot ID is given for the protein from A/Puerto Rico/8/34.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Donors had serum antibodies against one or more influenza A virus strains (A/H1N1 or A/H3N2), measured by hemagglutination inhibition assay (HIA), indicative of one or more exposures to influenza virus in the past. PBMCs infected with Influenza A (Resvir-9) at a multiplicity of infection = 3 where used to stimulate uninfected PBMCs for 9 days. IL-2 was added for the last 5 days of culture.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: In a fraction of HLA-A1 positive donors, CTLs generated by stimulation with Influenza virus are able to recognize epitope-loaded autologous BLCLs. The response is influenced by the accompanying HLA molecules, since frequency of responders is higher in HLA A1 HLA A2 and HLA B8 positive donors that are also HLA-B35 positive than in HLA-B27 positive donors. Strikingly, none of the HLA-1 and HLA-3 positive donor shows a response against this epitope, irrespective of the HLA-B alleles present. This effect is also seen in CTL precursor frequencies as assessed by ELISPOT, where the first group have a 3-fold higher frequency than the other two groups.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Donors had serum antibodies against one or more influenza A virus strains (A/H1N1 or A/H3N2), measured by hemagglutination inhibition assay (HIA), indicative of one or more exposures to influenza virus in the past. PBMCs infected with Influenza A (Resvir-9) at a multiplicity of infection = 3 where used to stimulate uninfected PBMCs for 9 days. IL-2 was added for the last 5 days of culture.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: In a fraction of HLA-A1 positive donors, CTLs generated by stimulation with Influenza virus are not able to recognize epitope-loaded autologous BLCLs. The response is seen to be influenced by the accompanying HLA molecules, since the non-responsders have also HLA-A3 allele, while responders are seen in HLA-A1 HLA-A2 positive donors, but only when they are also HLA-B35 positive, not if HLA-B27 positive. This effect is also seen in CTL precursor frequencies as assessed by ELISPOT, where the HLA-A1, -A2, -B35 group have a 3-fold higher frequency than the other two groups.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: No details on the origin of peptide specific CTL clone are provided.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Influenza virus-infected PBMCs from 2 HLA-1<sup>+</sup> donors activated the epitope-specific A1/NP clone to a similar extent as peptide-loaded BLCL, demonstrating its presentation in virus infected cells.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Influenza A Virus (H3N2) Resvir-9 is a reassortant between A/Puerto Rico/8/34 (H1N1) and A/Nanchang/933/95 (H3N2). Swiss-prot ID is given for the protein from A/Puerto Rico/8/34.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Donors had serum antibodies against one or more influenza A virus strains (A/H1N1 or A/H3N2), measured by hemagglutination inhibition assay (HIA), indicative of one or more exposures to influenza virus in the past. PBMCs infected with Influenza A (Resvir-9) at a multiplicity of infection = 3 where used to stimulate uninfected PBMCs for 9 days. IL-2 was added for the last 5 days of culture.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Among HLA-A*0101 positive donors, a fraction of CTLs generated by stimulation with Influenza virus are able to recognize epitope-loaded autologous BLCLs. If the response is analyzed in groups of donors where the accompanying HLA-A allele is either A*0201 or 0301, and the HLA-B alleles are B*0801 along with either B*2705 or B*35, no difference among the groups in the freq2uency of responders is seen, implying no influence of the other alleles present in the donors status. Similar results are seen in the CTL precursor frequency as assessed by ELISPOT.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Influenza A Virus (H3N2) Resvir-9 is a reassortant between A/Puerto Rico/8/34 (H1N1) and A/Nanchang/933/95 (H3N2). Swiss-prot ID is given for the protein from A/Puerto Rico/8/34.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Donors had serum antibodies against one or more influenza A virus strains (A/H1N1 or A/H3N2), measured by hemagglutination inhibition assay (HIA), indicative of one or more exposures to influenza virus in the past. PBMCs infected with Influenza A (Resvir-9) at a multiplicity of infection = 3 where used to stimulate uninfected PBMCs for 9 days. IL-2 was added for the last 5 days of culture.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: In a fraction of HLA-A*0201 positive donors, CTLs generated by stimulation with Influenza virus are able to recognize epitope-loaded autologous BLCLs. Similar results are seen in CTL precursor frequencies as assesed by ELISPOT.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Epitope position is assigned as 128-135 by the authors, but the actual position is 125-132 in all the strains documented. Influenza A Virus (H3N2) Resvir-9 is a reassortant between A/Puerto Rico/8/34 (H1N1) and A/Nanchang/933/95 (H3N2). Swiss-prot ID is given for the protein from A/Puerto Rico/8/34. The sequence position is 125-132 in all databases.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Donors had serum antibodies against one or more influenza A virus strains (A/H1N1 or A/H3N2), measured by hemagglutination inhibition assay (HIA), indicative of one or more exposures to influenza virus in the past. PBMCs infected with Influenza A (Resvir-9) at a multiplicity of infection = 3 where used to stimulate uninfected PBMCs for 9 days. IL-2 was added for the last 5 days of culture.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CTLs generated by stimulation with Influenza virus give a very low response (<5% specific lysis) against epitope-loaded autologous BLCLs. This is correlated with the very low CTL precursor frequency detected in ELISPOT assays.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Influenza A Virus (H3N2) Resvir-9 is a reassortant between A/Puerto Rico/8/34 (H1N1) and A/Nanchang/933/95 (H3N2). Swiss-prot ID is given for the protein from A/Puerto Rico/8/34.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Donors had serum antibodies against one or more influenza A virus strains (A/H1N1 or A/H3N2), measured by hemagglutination inhibition assay (HIA), indicative of one or more exposures to influenza virus in the past. PBMCs infected with Influenza A (Resvir-9) at a multiplicity of infection = 3 where used to stimulate uninfected PBMCs for 9 days. IL-2 was added for the last 5 days of culture.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: In a fraction of HLA-A3 positive donors, CTLs generated by stimulation with Influenza virus are able to recognize epitope-loaded autologous BLCLs. The CTL precursor frequency, as assessed by ELISPOT, correlated with the cytotoxic activity.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Influenza A Virus (H3N2) Resvir-9 is a reassortant between A/Puerto Rico/8/34 (H1N1) and A/Nanchang/933/95 (H3N2). Swiss-prot ID is given for the protein from A/Puerto Rico/8/34.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Donors had serum antibodies against one or more influenza A virus strains (A/H1N1 or A/H3N2), measured by hemagglutination inhibition assay (HIA), indicative of one or more exposures to influenza virus in the past. PBMCs infected with Influenza A (Resvir-9) at a multiplicity of infection = 3 where used to stimulate uninfected PBMCs for 9 days. IL-2 was added for the last 5 days of culture.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: In a fraction of HLA-B8 positive donors, CTLs (shown in one case to be CD8+ cells) generated by stimulation with Influenza virus are able to recognize epitope-loaded autologous BLCLs. The response is influenced by the accompanying HLA molecules, since the average response is lower in donors that are also HLA-B27 positive than in also HLA-B35 positive donors. This effect is also seen in CTL precursor frequencies as assessed by ELISPOT.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Influenza A Virus (H3N2) Resvir-9 is a reassortant between A/Puerto Rico/8/34 (H1N1) and A/Nanchang/933/95 (H3N2). Swiss-prot ID is given for the protein from A/Puerto Rico/8/34.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Donors had serum antibodies against one or more influenza A virus strains (A/H1N1 or A/H3N2), measured by hemagglutination inhibition assay (HIA), indicative of one or more exposures to influenza virus in the past. PBMCs infected with Influenza A (Resvir-9) at a multiplicity of infection = 3 where used to stimulate uninfected PBMCs for 9 days. IL-2 was added for the last 5 days of culture.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: In HLA-B*2705 positive donors, CTLs generated by stimulation with Influenza virus are able to recognize epitope-loaded autologous BLCLs. The CTL precursor frequency as measured by ELISPOT is high in 2 of those donors.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Influenza A Virus (H3N2) Resvir-9 is a reassortant between A/Puerto Rico/8/34 (H1N1) and A/Nanchang/933/95 (H3N2). Swiss-prot ID is given for the protein from A/Puerto Rico/8/34.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Donors had serum antibodies against one or more influenza A virus strains (A/H1N1 or A/H3N2), measured by hemagglutination inhibition assay (HIA), indicative of one or more exposures to influenza virus in the past. PBMCs infected with Influenza A (Resvir-9) at a multiplicity of infection = 3 where used to stimulate uninfected PBMCs for 9 days. IL-2 was added for the last 5 days of culture.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: In a fraction HLA-B*2705 positive donors, CTLs generated by stimulation with Influenza virus are able to recognize epitope-loaded autologous BLCLs. The CTL precursor frequency as measured by ELISPOT is correlated with the cytotoxic activity.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Influenza A Virus (H3N2) Resvir-9 is a reassortant between A/Puerto Rico/8/34 (H1N1) and A/Nanchang/933/95 (H3N2). Swiss-prot ID is given for the protein from A/Puerto Rico/8/34.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Donors had serum antibodies against one or more influenza A virus strains (A/H1N1 or A/H3N2), measured by hemagglutination inhibition assay (HIA), indicative of one or more exposures to influenza virus in the past. PBMCs infected with Influenza A (Resvir-9) at a multiplicity of infection = 3 where used to stimulate uninfected PBMCs for 9 days. IL-2 was added for the last 5 days of culture.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: From A*0201 donors, CTLs generated by stimulation with Influenza virus are able to recognize epitope-loaded autologous BLCLs, with a high frequency of responders and percentage of specific lysis, congruently with the known immunodominance of this epitope. CTL precursor frequencies, as assessed by ELISPOT, are also higher towards this epitope than to other Influenza epitopes in these donors.
